results.name: Triangle read by rows: the unsigned Lah numbers T(n,k) = binomial(n-1, k-1)*n!/k! if n > 0 and k > 0, T(n,0) = 0^n and otherwise 0, for n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n.
comment: The Lah numbers can be seen as the case m=1 of the family of triangles T_{m}(n,k) = T_{m}(n-1,k-1)+(k^m+(n-1)^m)*T_{m}(n-1,k) (see the link 'Partition transform').
This is the Sheffer triangle (lower triangular infinite matrix) (1, x/(1-x)), an element of the Jabotinsky subgroup of the Sheffer group. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 12 2017

formula: For a collection of formulas see the 'Lah numbers' link.
L(n,k) = A097805(n,k)*n!/k! = (-1)^k*P_{n,k}(1,1,1,...) where P_{n,k}(s) is the partition transform of s.
L(n,k) = coeff(n! * P(n), x, k) with P(n) = (1/n)*(Sum_{k=0..n-1}(x(n-k)*P(k))), for n >= 1 and P(n=0) = 1, with x(n) = n*x. See A036039. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jul 08 2016
E.g.f. of row polynomials R(n, x) = Sum_{k=0..n} L(n,k)*x^k (that is egf of the triangle) is exp(x*t/(1-t)) (a Sheffer triangle of the Jabotinsky type).
Three term recurrence: L(n,k) = L(n-1,k-1) + (n-1+k)*L(n,k-1), n >= 1, k = 0..n, with L(0,0) =1, L(n,-1) = 0, L(n,k) = 0 if n < k.
L(n,k) = binomial(n,k)*fallfac(x=n-1,n-k), with fallfac(x,n) := Product_{j=0..(n-1)} (x - j), for n >= 1, and 0 for n = 0.
risefac(x,n) = Sum_{k=0..n} L(n,k)*fallfac(k), with risefac(x,n) :=  Product_{j=0..(n-1)} (x + j), for n >= 1, and 0 for n = 0.
See Graham et al., exercise 31, p. 312, solution p. 552.
Formally, let f_n(x) = Sum_{k>n} (k-1)!*x^k; then f_n(x)=Sum_{k=0..n} L(n,k)*x^(n+k)*f_0^((k))(x), where ^((k)) stands for the k-th derivative. - _Luc Rousseau_, Dec 27 2020
